docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Sept. 17 (AP) Tupamaro guerrillas sent an antigovernment manifesto to news media today and demanded its immediate publication as ransom for Claude L. Fly, United States soul expert kidnapped in early August.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Sept. 17 (AP) Tupamaro guerrillas sent an antigovernment manifesto to news media today and demanded its immediate publication as ransom for Claude L. Fly, United States soul expert kidnapped in early August.

headline.main: URUGUAY REBELS PROPOSE A DEAL; Offer to Yield U.S. Adviser If Manifesto Is Publicized

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Sept. 19 (UPI) Terrorists believed to be members of the Tupamaro guerrilla group raided a nightclub on the outskirts of the capital today, locked three employer in a closet and set the nightclub afire.

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Sept. 122 The Uruguayan Government today reiterated its refusal to offer ransom of any kind to Marxist guerrillas holding a United States soil expert and a Brazilian diplomat as hostages.

byline.original: By MALCOLM W.BROWNE Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: MADRID, Sept. 23 (AP)-- Tom Kite of Austin, Tex., finished with three birdies on the last four holes for a 71 today that gave, the United States a one-stroke lead over South Africa in the first round of the Eisenhower Cup world amateur golf...
docs.lead_paragraph: MADRID, Sept. 23 (AP)-- Tom Kite of Austin, Tex., finished with three birdies on the last four holes for a 71 today that gave, the United States a one-stroke lead over South Africa in the first round of the Eisenhower Cup world amateur golf championship.

headline.main: U.S. TEAM LEADS CUP GOLF BY SHOT; South Africa Second at 214 in Eisenhower Tourney

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Sept. 25--The Latin American spring has begun to warm the air over the beautiful beaches, and the Tupamaro guerrillas, in common with everyone else in Uruguay, apparently want to take a few months off.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Sept. 25--The Latin American spring has begun to warm the air over the beautiful beaches, and the Tupamaro guerrillas, in common with everyone else in Uruguay, apparently want to take a few months off.
docs.abstract: Tupamaros pledge to carry out new reign of terror following Pacheco's rejection of truce offer; leaders in jail have continued to operate from there; ingenious message operations noted; Govt is confident of victory; fate of 2 hostages uncertain

headline.main: NEW TERRORISM SEEN IN URUGUAY; Guerrillas Wanted a Truce but President Barred It

byline.original: By MALCOLM W. BROWNE Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: RIO de JANEIRO, Sept. 27 An inter-American committee completed today the draft of a convention to discourage terrorism, the kidnapping of diplomats and the hijacking of aircraft.
docs.lead_paragraph: RIO de JANEIRO, Sept. 27 An inter-American committee completed today the draft of a convention to discourage terrorism, the kidnapping of diplomats and the hijacking of aircraft.
docs.abstract: 11-nation Inter-Amer Juridical com, Rio, sets pact on kidnapping, other terrorism that would consider such acts as common crimes, not pol actions; Chile and Peru reptdly opposed; pact will be submitted to Gen Assembly of Amer States convention

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Oct. 2-- Latin-American Marxists, who have increasingly found common cause with such traditional enemies as Roman Catholic priests and army generals, are now extending the spirit of cooperation to the bitterest adversaries of all--rival...
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Oct. 2-- Latin-American Marxists, who have increasingly found common cause with such traditional enemies as Roman Catholic priests and army generals, are now extending the spirit of cooperation to the bitterest adversaries of all--rival leftists.
docs.abstract: discussion of apparent beginnings of cooperation between traditionalist Communist parties and more radical movements in Latin Amer cites unity of factions behind Allende; his victory seen indicating to Marxists that Latin-Amer power is within reach but only if they cooperate

headline.main: Rival Latin Marxists Begin to Cooperate

byline.original: By MALCOLM W. BROWNE Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: A Royal Air Force plane left London last Wednesday for Cairo with a single passenger, Miss Leila Khaled, a  Palestinian commando who had successfully commandeered a T.W.A. jet to Syria a year ago but had failed in her attempt on an El Al airliner on...
docs.lead_paragraph: A Royal Air Force plane left London last Wednesday for Cairo with a single passenger, Miss Leila Khaled, a Palestinian commando who had successfully commandeered a T.W.A. jet to Syria a year ago but had failed in her attempt on an El Al airliner on that fateful Sept. 5.
docs.abstract: act of hijacking revd in historical worldwide perspective in light of release of Khaled and 6 others; cartoon

headline.main: Law; Hijacks: New Tricks In an Old Game
